alert.note: Alert for Christian; De Witt; Logan; Macon; Mason; Menard; Morgan; Sangamon; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 12:10PM CDT until June 29 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Menard County in central Illinois... Logan County in central Illinois... Christian County in central Illinois... Sangamon County in central Illinois... De Witt County in central Illinois... Southeastern Tazewell County in central Illinois... Southeastern Mason County in central Illinois... Macon County in central Illinois... Southeastern Morgan County in west central Illinois... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 1209 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from San Jose to near Waverly, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... San Jose and Emden around 1215 PM CDT. Hartsburg around 1220 PM CDT. Auburn and Divernon around 1225 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Pawnee, Atlanta, Waynesville, Bulpitt, Taylorville, Kincaid, Edinburg, Jeisyville, Stonington and Moweaqua. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 0 and 11. Interstate 55 between mile markers 77 and 141. Interstate 72 between mile markers 77 and 146. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Christian; De Witt; Logan; Macon; Mason; Menard; Morgan; Sangamon; Tazewell
